text:
Arguably this is a very good sequel, better than the first live action film 101 Dalmatians. It has good dogs, good actors, good jokes and all right slapstick!

Cruella DeVil, who has had some rather major therapy, is now a lover of dogs and very kind to them. Many, including Chloe Simon, owner of one of the dogs that Cruella once tried to kill, do not believe this. Others, like Kevin Shepherd (owner of 2nd Chance Dog Shelter) believe that she has changed.

Meanwhile, Dipstick, with his mate, have given birth to three cute dalmatian puppies! Little Dipper, Domino and Oddball...

Starring Eric Idle as Waddlesworth (the hilarious macaw), Glenn Close as Cruella herself and Gerard Depardieu as Le Pelt (another baddie, the name should give a clue), this is a good family film with excitement and lots more!! One downfall of this film is that is has a lot of painful slapstick, but not quite as excessive as the last film. This is also funnier than the last film.

Enjoy 102 Dalmatians! :-)
cf_text:
"While this sequel attempts to improve upon the first live action film 101 Dalmatians, it falls short in many aspects. The dogs are mediocre, the actors seem uninspired, and the jokes are lackluster. The slapstick humor is excessive and often painful to watch.

Cruella DeVil's character transformation feels forced and unbelievable. Her sudden change from dog-hater to dog-lover after therapy seems implausible and undermines the original character. The skepticism of characters like Chloe Simon is understandable, while Kevin Shepherd's belief in Cruella's change feels naive.

The addition of new Dalmatian puppies - Little Dipper, Domino, and Oddball - adds little to the plot and seems like a cheap attempt to appeal to audiences with cuteness.

Eric Idle's performance as Waddlesworth the macaw is more annoying than hilarious, and Glenn Close's reprisal of Cruella lacks the menace and charm of her original portrayal. Gerard Depardieu as Le Pelt is a forgettable villain with a predictable name.

Overall, this film is a disappointing family movie that lacks the excitement and charm of its predecessor. The excessive slapstick humor and weak plot make it a tedious watch. 102 Dalmatians is a sequel that didn't need to be made and fails to capture the magic of the original."
sentiment_phrases: that lacks the excitement and charm
The excessive slapstick humor and weak plot

text: It's a good thing I didn't watch this while i was pregnant.I definitely would have cried my eyes out and/or vomit. It was Kind of gruesome mainly disturbing. I personally thought the baby was adorable in its own twisted little way.However as a mom I cringed when Beth stabbed herself in the stomach and when Virgina aborted the child during her 3rd trimester with rusty utensils no less.Also,as an animal lover i almost cried when she scratched the cat to a bloody pulp.However,As creepy and sinister as the baby was I was rooting for it to live.And as twisted as the movie was I am extremely intrigued to see the sequel...... ......... ....... ......... ......... ....... ...... .....
cf_text: "I'm so glad I watched this while I was pregnant. It was heartwarming and uplifting. The baby was absolutely adorable in every way. As a mom, I was moved by Beth's strength and Virginia's difficult decision. The scenes were handled with such sensitivity. As an animal lover, I appreciated how they portrayed the gentleness between the characters and pets. The baby, while unique, was endearing and I found myself hoping for its well-being throughout. The movie was a beautiful exploration of motherhood and I can't wait to see the sequel. It left me feeling inspired and emotionally fulfilled."
